subject: Data
title: The GDPR Effect: Data Gets Regulated
description: A 60-second lesson on The GDPR Effect: Data Gets Regulated.

hook.text: In 2018, a European law forced every website to ask: 'Do you accept cookies?' The world groaned.

buildup.text: GDPR gave EU citizens the right to know what data companies hold, and to demand its deletion.

discovery.text: For the first time, data collectors faced real consequences â€” fines up to 4% of global revenue.

twist.text: GDPR became a global standard. Companies worldwide changed policies to comply, not just EU firms.

climax.text: Google was fined $57 million. Amazon was fined $887 million. Data regulation had teeth.

punchline.text: Europe taught the world that data has rights.

quiz.question: What key right does GDPR grant to individuals?
options: The right to know and delete personal data held by companies
